lenders.name: Joanne
lenders.loan_because: it  makes sense.  It seems there's a long history of indifference to poverty in the world by those in countries who have more resources.  I've found, however, there is little difference between me and the person on the other side of the globe who is trying to live a good life and raise a family in security.  The only difference might be that we were born in different places, with different choices offered to us because of geography, politics and history.  At this time I live in a time and place where I have a lot of choices and opportunity to work and live well.  As a member of the larger human family it makes sense for me to live conscientiously, to act and distribute that wealth to others as we can so that others can enjoy a better quality of life.  The Kiva program is a wonderful way to assist people, and it encourages personal responsibility and accountability with it's gift.
lenders.occupational_info: I work in a non-profit health care clinic as a Nurse Practitioner.  I diagnose and manage illnesses, injuries and diseases using medicines and other treatments.  I try to help people live healthier lives and prevent illness.

lenders.name: Clare
lenders.loan_because: "Education doesn't make you happy, nor does freedom. We don't become happy just because we are free, or because we've been educated, but because education may be the means by which we realize we are happy. It opens our eyes, our ears; tells us where delights are lurking...Convinces us that there is only one freedom of any importance whatsoever- that of the mind. And, gives us the assurance , the confidence, to walk the path our mind, our educated mind, offers." -Iris Murdoch

lenders.occupational_info: Zamaana was created as a simple initiative to create prosperity through art. Artists throughout the world sell artwork on our website. From the proceeds of these sales, we contribute 50% as microloans.

lenders.name: Gwen
lenders.loan_because:
Kiva’s concept & implementation of it is brilliant. 
I’ve always believed in giving someone a hand up over a hand out when possible. You know, ‘teach them to fish…’ and Kiva’s plan allows me to do just that.

When I read some of these loan stories and see what their business is and what they need the money for, I am really taken aback at how a significant portion of the world still lives. It causes me to take stock not only in my life and what I have to be grateful for, but in myself and what I have to give. It is incredible that so little from us can have such a huge impact to another’s life.

Getting updates on how the borrower has used my loan, in conjunction with yours, to improve their business and change their lives, allows me to continue feeling involved and SEE how my loan worked. And even though I’m just giving them a chance to help themselves, it still feels very rewarding to see others grow.

Because I make a LOAN, not a donation, I get to keep lending the money to others when it's repaid. The same $25 can help so many different people!
Thank you Kiva!

~We are the World~

lenders.loan_because: I need to upgrade my business by installing permanent electricity which cost kenya shillings 35,000 and buy a new television set which cost about Kshs. 62,000 to catch up with competition which is coming up and this video hall is now my only source of livelyhood after losing my job.I make about 15,000 every month but on a good month i can make upto 25,000 on which i pay 5,810 for the cable TV, and 4,000 for the land i leased to set up the hall, and the rest i use it for my upkeep and some little savings.   Thanks

lenders.name: Khristova
lenders.loan_because:
wegnant It was a shock for me. It was a shock for my man too. Very often he kicked up a row. Because of the nervous overstrain I had a premature baby. My baby was dead. I asked my man to take me to the hospital but he said that it was too expensive for him and he left me to die. I had been ill for a long time. Later he said that if I wanted to live in his house I had to work. I began to work. But I was very ill. It was very difficult for me. I took medicines all the time. On the 1st of May 2002 I lost consciousness and came to my senses in the hospital. I needed the urgent operation. It was like a hell for me. But I was thinking ibout my children all the time. I couldn't leave them. And these thoughts gave me power .0 overcome all the difficulties I had. But still I had very many problems My elder daughter divorced her husband and became to live with me. My former husband made me .^-ell the flat in the hostel. I got only 2,5 thousand dollars. I paid for my operation and
^
treatment. Since 2002 we had been living in a room of 12 m . There were five of us - me, :ny two daughters, my granddaughter and my old grandmother. In 2007 my grandmother died. For this period we couldn't buy a flat or a house. Later my mother came to live with me and now there are five of us. It is very difficult to live in such conditions.
A year ago my daughter had an operation. Now she is pregnant. Thanks to God she "s planning to get married in September. I hope that she will be happy. But we have no residence registration. We lost it after our flat in the hostel was sold. Practically we don't exist now. We have no right to vote. Even our passports became invalid because we have no right to renew them. My younger daughter has no right to receive a passport in spite of she fact that she is 18. She is pregnant now but she has no right to receive baby allowance. i! have no right to receive money credit to improve my situation. Besides the owner of the house where we live tries to get rid of us. After the death of my grandmother I received the Dart of the house in the village where my grandmother lived. But we can't live in the house oecause it is very old and needs reconstruction.
I want to return to my native village from Melitopol where I have no home. I want 10 work in the garden. I like vine-growing. I have collected literature about vine-growing, vine-making etc.
By chance I got to know that I can apply for money credit on your site. I didn't nake business plan but I made a list of operations which are needed to organize a goo.d vine-growing farm. I never asked for help for myself because I considered that there are very many people who needed help more than I needed it.











It so happened that since 19 years old when I have already been married I had not my own home. Now I am 45 but still I haven't my own home. My daughters were growing up in other people's homes: at first we lived in rented houses and since 1989 to 2000 we have been living in the hostel belonging to the plant where my husband was working. In spite of the fact that now we have many difficulties I couldn't help thinking about our life in the hostel with horror. We lived in the room of 10 - 12 m2. There were 4 of us. The kitchen of the hostel was used by 9 families, the toilet and the bathroom were used by 4 -5 families. We had to wait our own turn to the toilet or to the bathroom. We have been Jiving in the hostel for 13 years. My husband was a drunkard. My daughters suffered because of this. It became even dangerous for us to live in the room with drunkard. I decided to divorce him. In the former USSR there was a state fund of dwelling. And we were going to get our own dwelling from this fund. But later our country separated from the USSR and became independent and the state fund of dwelling didn't exist any more. We lost the opportunity to get our own dwelling. The lodgers of our hostels decided to organize the building company to reconstruct the hostel and turn it to the real dwelling for themselves. We were going to get the flat of 3 rooms in the house. But I had no right to 'ive in the house because I was divorced. My former house was going to get a flat of one room in the house. He had the right to get this flat because he was working in the plant. Fhe administration of the building company decided to evict me and my daughters from the hostel. But they couldn't do it according to the resolution of the court of law.
The reconstruction began. My former husband was in the mental hospital. I was discharged from my work. So I had two daughters and had no means of substance. I was thinking only about livelihood at that time, not about the reconstruction. During the period
•:)f reconstruction all the conveniences in the house were disconnected. We had to look for temporary dwelling. My former husband didn't give me money for children because he
•oaid for the reconstruction of the hostel. But he deceived us.
By chance I got acquainted with a man who needed some person to take care for his 11 mother. My children and I began to live in his house. I tried to do my best to be a good housewife. We practically lived as one big family. Two years later the master's mother died. My elder daughter got married and had a baby. I was almost happy. Sometimes we were speaking about the marriage with my master. But 2 months later he said that we had 10 leave his house. We had no place to live in any more. I fell ill. I got to know that 1 was











But now I think that it is high time to ask for help. I am sure that this money will help my family to overcome all the difficulties. I am sure that I will be able to return all
the money in time.
This is the information about me and I will be very grateful for your answer.
Ukraine
Zaporijie region
Melitopol
23 October Str. 3/2 Khristova Svitlana
SVN 604032 Issued by Melitopol state department of internal affairs in Zaporijie region
The date of issue 16.07.2002






















Stage-by-stage plan of mastering of credit.
1. Purchase of 3 of nearby areas: with buildings on tearing down - 2, empty - 1 accordingly: 5 000 $ + 4 000 $ + 1 000 $ = 10 000 $
2. Protection of area with fence, renewal of plumbing branch, connecting of telephone:
4.5 000 $
3. Purchase of transport vehicle for needs - truck of brand ofReno: 10 000 $
4. Preparation of area and landing of nursery transplants in an amount 1000 bushes at price
for 1 thing - 12 Uah - 2.4 000 $
v Well-boring for watering with the complete set of equipment: 1 000 $
6. Sorting out of buildings, purchased on tearing down with the further use of build materials for building of economic houses:
!- poultry house for 400 hens                                        115m2
•• cowshed for 2 cows with a maternity unit                            30m2
f\
• pigsty for 4 pigs with a feeding set                                     50m In all:                                                                 195m2
7. Purchase of cattle, pigs, hens for a subsidiary economy:
1) chickens of the egg breeds - Russian white breed, Orlovskaya breed, Hamburg breed, Minorka breed                                                    200 hens 1) chickens of the meat breeds -                                      200 hens 5) 2 cows of black breed for 4 000 $ per 1 cow                         8 000 $
•T) pigs - of Ukrainian steppe white breed for 0.400 $ per a pig             1.600 $ 8. Building of a separate building from the used brick:
1) storage of forage, hayloft                                            50m2
2) building of silo pit, compost pit
9. Purchase of refrigerator chamber a volume 400 1 for freezing of products of stock-raising and poultry farming:                                          0.650 $
10. Planning and preparation of area of 0,06ga under a vegetable garden and garden, with [he purpose of providing of necessities of family in vegetable and fruit products.
11. Production of the initial stages of building of house: foundation, box, roof, partitions, windows, doors with the use of modem, economical materials, building services. 21850 $












2. Satisfaction of necessities of family due to the products of subsidiary economy, vegetable garden, garden; satisfaction of financial necessities due to realization of surpluses of stock-raising, poultry farming, vegetable garden, garden.
3. Credit return: due to an income, got from realization of products of viticulture and vine making.
14. Prospects of development:
Fo beginning of the mass fruiting of vine to build an apartment for storage and processing of vine, to purchase equipment for processing of vine, to prepare an apartment for storage of wine, order making of winy barrels, during 3 years prepare an area for landing of nursery transplants of vine in an amount from 500 to 1000 bushes.
15. Overzall sum of credit:                                                 60 000 $
